main event: A radar operator in New Madison, Ohio, detected an unidentified target that accelerated and disappeared off the radar on May 30, 1952.
interesting points: The target was first picked up at a distance of 15 miles and approached the station steadily before disappearing., The radar operator and duty officer are considered reliable observers., No known aircraft were reported in the area at the time., An additional letter from a witness reported seeing a strange glowing object in the sky on May 19, 1959., The letter described the object as appearing like a moon behind a cloud with a strange glow.
sighted object: unidentified target on radar and a glowing object in the sky
witness description: radar operator and duty officer, and a citizen who reported a sighting
